results.title: Out of Our Minds by Felipe Fernández-Armesto | Goodreads
results.content: As a species we stand alone in our remarkable capacity to refashion the world after the picture in our minds. Traversing the realms of science, politics, religion, culture, philosophy, and history, Felipe Fernández-Armesto reveals the thrilling and disquieting tales of our imaginative leaps—from the first Homo sapiens to the present day.

results.title: Felipe Fernández-Armesto - The Pol Roger Duff Cooper Prize
results.content: Felipe Fernández-Armesto is William P. Reynolds Professor of History at the University of Notre Dame, USA. His recent publications include 1492: The Year Our World Began (2011), Pathfinders: A Global History of Exploration (2006) and The Conquistadors: A Very Short Introduction (2011)

results.title: The Oxford Illustrated History of the World - Google Books
results.content: Felipe Fernandez-Armesto was an undergraduate and graduate student at Oxford (Demy of Magdalen College, Senior Scholar of St John's, Fellow of St Antony's) where he was a member of the Modern History Faculty before moving to chairs in the University of London (Professor of Global Environmental History at Queen Mary College), Tufts University (Prince of Asturias Professor), and the University ...

results.title: Near a Thousand Tables: A History of Food - amazon.com
results.content: In Near a Thousand Tables, acclaimed food historian Felipe Fernández-Armesto tells the fascinating story of food as cultural as well as culinary history -- a window on the history of mankind.
